annotation.TEXT: If you pick up the relic for the stage and take it to Chester, he'll trade you it for something that Plague Knight can actually use. In this case, it's the "Big Boom" - a large bomb that lobs out in a small arc before exploding in a cross-pattern. The explosion itself is decently strong, and works well for clearing out small clusters of enemies or blowing up large amounts of blocks.

Yes, Plague Knight can obtain the same relics from the main story...and he finds all of them to be complete rubbish. They're still worth collecting however, as they'll allow you to obtain more useful items if you seek out a particular character located elsewhere in the levels...

Lob Casing is one of the more useful pieces of equipment for your bombs. In certain situations (especially in the case of one particular boss), it makes things far easier than if you were to use the normal casing. Its effectiveness can be further enhanced with different types of powder and fuses, which also pretty much goes for the other equipment in the game. Really, it's up to you to experiment with them and find which combinations work well for whatever situation you're in.

King Knight is still pretty easy - so naturally I mess up on him more times than I should. I guess this is just one of those segments where the stage went pretty well, but everything kind of goes downhill once it gets to the boss fight. Hopefully that won't turn into a pattern for the rest of this run (especially when it comes to Propeller Knight).
